humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the size of the largest tumor as 3.2 x 2.2 x 1.6 cm. Using the rules provided, a T2 tumor is more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the infiltrating ductal carcinoma forms a 3.2 x 2.2 x 1.6 cm mass in the left breast, which is classified as AJCC pT2. The T stage is determined by the size of the primary tumor, and in this case, the size is within the T2 range (2-5 cm). Therefore, the T stage is T2.
